name: The Stake Out Quiz | 'Seinfeld' - Season 1 | 10 Questions

questions.text: Where are Jerry and Elaine in the beginning of the episode?
questions.explanation:
Movie store.

	Jerry and Elaine can't decide on a movie to see because Elaine has seen most of the movies.  He asks Elaine if she's seen one of the adult videos in the store.

questions.text: What is the name of the woman who Jerry and Elaine have dinner with for her birthday?
questions.explanation:
Pamela.

	Jerry had previously met Pamela when he and Elaine were dating.  H e makes a big deal of going to the party without a gift.

questions.text: Who had wooden teeth in Elaine's dream?
questions.explanation:
Jerry.

	While talking to a beautiful woman, Elaine interrupts and tells Jerry of a dream she had the previous night where he was in her old house and he had jagged wooden teeth.

questions.text: Who is staying at Jerry's house for a weekend?
questions.explanation:
His parents.

	Jerry's parents are in town for a relative's wedding, so Jerry asks them how he can find the girl he met at Pamela's party.

questions.text: Who waits with Jerry in the law office building?
questions.explanation:
George.

	Jerry's father suggests that he stake out the lobby of the building, and when the woman gets off the elevator for lunch, he make a move.

questions.text: What is the alias that George creates in the building's lobby?
questions.explanation:
Art Vandelay.

	Art Vandelay appears many times in the episode as an importer/exporter, and all of the characters use the alias at least once.

questions.text: What is the name of the woman from the party?
questions.explanation:
Vanessa.

	Vanessa works at a law firm with a very long name, and she and Pamela used to go to law school together.

questions.text: What is the word that Kramer uses to help Jerry's mother in Scrabble?
questions.explanation:
Quone.

	Kramer insists that it's actually a word, but Jerry challenges the word and doesn't find it in the dictionary.

True.

	Jerry and Elaine work out an agreement where she and him can talk about other people that they like and not need to feel awkward.

questions.text: What is the name of Jerry's cousin?
questions.explanation:
Artie.

	Jerry's cousin is Artie, and Jerry's uncle is Mac.  Mac is writing an autobiography of his memories.
